Body:
Could anyone give examples of context-sensitive sentences that cannot be generated by context-free rules?

To clarify, they are generated by rules including at least one that is in the form αβγ→αψγ, α,γ are not empty and we cannot find any context-free grammar that can generate it.

EDIT "Language" here means natural languages.
Title: Could anyone give examples of context-sensitive sentences that cannot be generated by context-free rules?

LastEditedUser.AboutMe:
Travelling armchair linguist.

Never studied in an institution but read books and web with probably more breadth than depth.

Always on the road surviving in a strange foreign language, currently Mongolian and Mandarin Chinese.

And I collect dictionaries.

OwnerUser.AboutMe: a teacher at university in china who is not a mathematician.:)
